author: MrLiamMcQ
body:
three functions do not work:

Get-WinDefaultInputMethodOverride
Set-WinDefaultInputMethodOverride "0419:00000419"
Set-WinSystemLocale -SystemLocale ru-RU

note i have the languages installed ! an using powershell 5.1 and commands were run using admin powershell.

Get-WinDefaultInputMethodOverride throws an exception
nevermind suddenly Get-WinDefaultInputMethodOverride started working

Set-WinDefaultInputMethodOverride  "0419:00000419"(4019 is russian) correctly sets the registry values located at HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Keyboard Layout\Preload and also it correctly shows the language it was supposed to switch so in "Advanced keyboard settings" but this dose not change the keyboard language as expected:

Set-WinSystemLocale -SystemLocale ru-RU doesn't seem to do anything, i call Get-WinSystemLocale and it just returns and says am english no matter how many times i do the command.

note "Set-WinUserLanguageList ru-RU -Force" successfully changes the keyboard language but is slow and removes all other languages installed.
![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28570401/64428665-3a258300-d0ac-11e9-9a68-01a374bc1330.png)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@MrLiamMcQ The cmdlets are not in the repo. Please move the issue to https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellModuleCoverage repository.
GitHub
PowerShell/PowerShellModuleCoverage
Track issues related to using Windows PowerShell modules with PowerShell Core 6 - PowerShell/PowerShellModuleCoverage

title: 3 non working keyboard setting commands
